Owelty.origin: [Anglo-French oelté equality, from Latin aequalitat- aequalitas ]

-ties.definition: [Anglo-Frenchequality, from Latin]a lien created or a pecuniary sum paid by order of the court to effect an equitable partition of property (as in divorce) when such a partition in kind would be impossible, impracticable, or prejudicial to one of the parties [an award]
